client.util_client package¶

Submodules¶

client.util_client.send_http_request module¶

This sends a HTTP request (POST, GET, DELETE, PATCH, …) to a server and returns the response.

client.util_client.send_http_request.send_http_request(http_method, api_endpoint, connection_data, data_to_transmit)[source]¶

A prototype for sending JSON data to an API endpoint on a target host.

Parameters:
  • http_method (str, {GET, POST, DELETE, PATCH}) – The http method we want to employ.
  • api_enpoint (str) – API endpoint, as in http://HOST:PORT/api_enpoint.
  • connection_data (dict) – The connection data, containing target address and port and program headers containing program name and version.
  • data_to_transmit (dict) – The data we want to transmit in JSON format. A dict or a ready-formatted JSON package will work.
Returns:

The JSON object as returned from the backend.
Return type:

JSON object, dict
Raises:
  • TypeError – If one of the input parameters is not of the expected type.
  • ValueError – If the http_method is not on of GET, POST, DELETE, PATCH.

client.util_client.print_function_usage module¶

This module contains a function to reformat long strings.

client.util_client.print_function_usage.print_help(help_text)[source]¶

A small helper function that prints out a help string in a nice format.

Parameters:help_text (str) – The ‘unformated’ help string.
Returns:Nothing.
Return type:None

Todo

I think this can be done waaay more elegant…

client.util_client.test_host module¶

Check the target host.

client.util_client.test_host.target_online_and_compatible(c_data)[source]¶

Check whether or not we are dealing with a compatible server that is online.

Parameters:c_data (dict) – A dictionary containing target host and port as well as a header with a user-agent, which we use to figure out which backend version we hope to find.
Returns:False if the backend is not responding or is running a different version than the client and True if the backend is online and has the same version as the client.
Return type:bool

See also

backend.web_server_api.ServerAPI.connect_client()
